Did you know thereâ€™s a country that might completely vanish underwater within your lifetime?

Most of its land sits just 2 meters above sea level, and with the oceans rising, every storm swallows a little more of its future. Saltwater floods the fields. Homes are abandoned. And crops canâ€™t grow.

In response, the country took a drastic step: it signed a historic deal with Australia, known as the Falepili Act, allowing up to 280 of its citizens to relocate as climate refugees each year.

But hereâ€™s the wildest partâ€”this country is now building a digital version of itself. A full online replica of its land and culture in the metaverse. So it can live on, even if it sinks beneath the sea.

Itâ€™ll be the first nation to exist only in the cloud. And if you havenâ€™t guessed the country. Itâ€™s Tuvalu.
